page.title: 12Disabled at work _ B'head
page.content: Riverside Industries is a work-centre for handicapped people who can use public transport but wouldn't be happy in an ordinary factory. However, some people learn enough at Riverside to get an ordinary job. They go there to learn about work, to communicate with people , and to improve their mobility to have the satisfaction of making things. Some of the people we spoke to had problems in using their arms and legs, some were deaf and some had trouble with their speech. They made wooden panels,wooden cots and dolls. "I had never spoken to anyone who was handicapped before so I was a little afraid they might upset me but I enjoyed the visit and would like to go again. "They aren't "the handicapped" , but are "people with handicaps."
